item.title: Gr\"obner bases, resolutions, and the Lefschetz properties for powers of a general linear form in the squarefree algebra
item.description: arXiv:2411.10209v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: For the almost complete intersection ideals $(x_1^2, \dots, x_n^2, (x_1 + \cdots + x_n)^k)$, we compute their reduced Gr\"obner basis for any term ordering, revealing a combinatorial structure linked to lattice paths, elementary symmetric polynomials, and Catalan numbers. Using this structure, we classify the weak Lefschetz property for these ideals. Additionally, we provide a new proof of the well-known result that the squarefree algebra satisfies the strong Lefschetz property. Finally, we compute the Betti numbers of the initial ideals and construct a minimal free resolution using a Mayer-Vietoris tree approach.
item.dc:creator: Filip Jonsson Kling, Samuel Lundqvist, Fatemeh Mohammadi, Matthias Orth, Eduardo S\'aenz-de-Cabez\'on
